newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR CLOSES WEAKER ON IMPORT PRESSURE.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR CLOSES WEAKER ON IMPORT PRESSURE.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar was softer against most hard currencies at the close of Thursday's interbank trading session, initially weakening on importer demand, dealers said.
"We saw the local dollar losing a cent (from its morning levels) on the back of importer demand," a dealer said.
"The market wasn't that liquid and when one player started buying everyone jumped to protect their position," he said.
Trading on the day was mild.
The Zimbabwe dollar ended easier at 10.6950/7150 against the U.S. dollar compared to 10.6800/7000 the previous day and fell to 18.0000/0380 from Wednesday's 17.9080/9520 against sterling.
It edged up to 7.1160/1310 from 7.1240/1420 against the mark but was quoted softer at 2.3180/3240 versus South Africa's rand compared to 2.2920/2990.
